home.message: We are very aware that New Zealand is a long way for a large number of the people we care about. There is zero pressure to join. With this in mind - we will have a reception in Ghent in Summer ‘24.

schedule.location: Tony (Sam’s Dad) has helped replant land in Whangapoua with Native Bush. The ceremony will take place there, followed by a reception in a marquee on Waipapa Place.
schedule.outro: More information will be provided closer to the date

faqs.title: Ammenities
details: Whangapoua is a small beach settlement, with only one small general store that sells basic food supplies, baked goods, coffee, limited alcohol, petrol and diesel. We suggest bringing with you enough food and drinks for the weekend (Saturday night and Sunday is on us!) as the closest townships are Coromandel (20 minutes) and Whitianga (approx. 30 minutes).

If you are passing through Thames, PAKn’SAVE is located at 100 Mary Street and opening hours are 8am - 8pm. Liquorland, Liquor King and Thames Liquor Centre are located on Pollen Street. Opening hours vary, all closing by 9.30pm. Wine and beer will be provided at the wedding alongside some top shelf later in the night. If you prefer to drink something else at the reception, feel free to BYO.

faqs.title: Dress Code
details: No shirt, no shoes, no free drinks.

faqs.title: Gifts
details: Look, we know alot of you are traveling a LONG way. That is appreciated, and all we are really after.
With that in mind no gifts are necessary. However, if you wish to give a gift, we will gratefully accept a small contribution towards a honeymoon.

faqs.title: Parking / Getting Around
details: As Whangapoua is only a small place, you shouldn’t have to far to travel/ walk between your accommodation and where the reception will be held.

Parking is limited, so would suggest walking if possible or carpooling with others. For those who will be driving, please do not park on the driveway of Waipapa Place. The best locations to park, would either be on the main road, or in the small carpark down the very northern end of the beach, near the ceremony and reception locations.

diet.title: Do you have any dietary requirements?
